sections.heading: Overview
content:
Jon D. Kaiser, MD, graduated from the State University of New York with a
degree in philosophy and attended medical school at the University of Texas
Medical School in Houston. During his medical school training, he received
honors in Internal Medicine and Emergency Medicine. Perceiving limitations of a
purely mechanistic approach to the treatment of disease, Kaiser began to
explore the fields of nutrition, natural therapies, and emotional healing
techniques.

Kaiser trained in internal medicine at Kaiser Foundation Hospital in San
Francisco and began treating patients with HIV. Several years later he opened
his private practice, which quickly grew to capacity due to his unique and
comprehensive approach to HIV treatment.

In 1997, Kaiser became medical director of the Jon Kaiser Wellness Center,
where natural and standard medical therapies are combined in the treatment of
complex medical conditions. Kaiser's goal is to teach his comprehensive healing
program to patients and health care practitioners across the country and to
design research studies to further test and refine the approach. Kaiser's new
book, Healing HIV: How to Rebuild Your Immune System , is a comprehensive
treatment guide that teaches patients and practitioners how to improve
treatment outcomes while using less antiviral and total medication.
